descriptions.description:
As the risk and impact of Covid-19 became apparent in March of 2020, we realized that planning a large in-person event with any level of certainty was not possible, however, we also realized that all situations ultimately improve and we will collectively find a way to celebrate together with minimal risks. As we get closer to our event we will update this section with additional information, including anticipated safety protocols and any known restrictions. 

**February 2021**

The [vaccination trend](https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/#us) is positive. Based on current data, we are confident that the vaccine will be available to the majority of the population by end of summer 2021. We plan of getting the vaccine as soon as it becomes available to our demographic. Want to learn more about the [Covid vaccine](https://covid19.ca.gov/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=ca-covid19response-august2020&utm_term=covid%20reopening&gclid=Cj0KCQiAs5eCBhCBARIsAEhk4r4QzlJThgyQm-Hsm7_81o2K0N2-V2mxugOaxpLHuZ1Rc8GVTaM5ksQaAubiEALw_wcB)?

**March 2021**

[California](https://covid19.ca.gov/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=ca-covid19response-august2020&utm_term=covid%20reopening&gclid=Cj0KCQiAs5eCBhCBARIsAEhk4r4QzlJThgyQm-Hsm7_81o2K0N2-V2mxugOaxpLHuZ1Rc8GVTaM5ksQaAubiEALw_wcB) is scheduled to reopen public events by the beginning of April, another positive indicator that in-person events are no longer a distant memory, but something to look forward to once more.
